title: Barcelona transfer news: Director travels to Brazil to watch defensive target Yerry Mina train for Palmeiras
text:
Barca mina business Barcelona transfer news: Director travels to Brazil to watch defensive target Yerry Mina train for Palmeiras 
Catalans have pre-arrangement in place to sign 22-year-old Colombian centre-back and look set to make first move Gossip Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments BARCELONA’S technical director for football matters has travelled to Brazil to discuss terms over a deal to sign Yerry Mina, according to reports in Catalonia. 
The Colombian centre-back was one of the stand-out performers for Palmeiras last season. Getty Images 
Keep up to date with ALL the Barcelona news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
Should they decide to buy Mina now, it would cost them £7.8million. 
In 2018, the price would increase to £8.7m and 12 months later to £13.8m. 
Mundo Deportivo report Pep Segura has gone to Sao Paulo to personally watch the 22-year-old train. 
Ultimately, it will be Roberto Fernandez — the No.1 technical director — who will make the final decision. Getty Images Defender Yerry Mina scored an impressive four goals in first seven games last season Related Stories Barcelona's 16-year-old Labinot Kabashi dubbed 'new Andres Iniesta' goes from Kosovo refugee to international game Ped-Ache Antonio Conte admits Pedro's fine form is giving him a headache over Chelsea's front three attackers Catalan Champ Barcelona boss Luis Enrique feels Andres Iniesta is impossible to replace as he rues injury setback 'Welcome with open arms' Gerard Pique would love Barcelona to sign Liverpool star Philippe Coutinho 'I want to stay for many years' Ivan Rakitic says he wants to snub Manchester City and sign a new Barcelona deal Getty Images Yerry Mina celebrates after scoring an 84th-minute equaliser against Uruguay Getty Images 6 Yerry Mina reels away after rescuing point for Colombia at home to Uruguay 
However, Segura will take advantage of the visit, to see his son who lives in Rio de Janeiro. 
Barcelona are looking for long-term successors to Gerard Pique , 29, and Javier Mascherano , 32. 
Samuel Umtiti is expected to play a big role at the club, but he has been underwhelming so far. Getty Images 6 Yerry Mina shows his power by bulldozing Luis Suarez out of the way 
Measuring 6”3in., Mina is a powerful unit, capable of intimidating his opponents and dominant in the air. 
He has an eye for goal as he demonstrated with a late equaliser for Colombia against Uruguay in their 2-2 World Cup qualifying draw back in October 
Mina’s form was so impressive last season, he was the recipient of special privileges at Palmeiras. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog Getty Images 6 Yerry Mina gets stuck and could be long-term option for Barcelona’s defence 
After that draw against Uruguay in Barranquilla, he was flown back in a private jet for the following weekend’s match against Figueirense. 
He started his career at Deportivo Pasto, before moving to Santa Fe at the age of 19. 
Mina then moved to Palmeiras in the summer of 2016 and scored an impressive four goals in his first seven matches for the Brazilian side last season. Barcelona stars Neymar and Luis Suarez team up to prank Gerard Pique
